[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Structured Complaint Tracking and Lab Scheduling System (SCTLS) defines requirements for complaint reporting, automated lab scheduling, and equipment documentation, ensuring operational efficiency and structured management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: SCTLS supports complaint logging, response tracking, lab scheduling automation, and equipment record management.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: SCTLS integrates with admin dashboards for report generation, automated scheduling, and real-time equipment tracking.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: SCTLS provides a web-based UI for complaint submission, response tracking, and lab schedule monitoring.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: SCTLS runs on desktops, tablets, and mobile devices supporting web access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: SCTLS uses React.js for frontend, Node.js with Express for backend, and PostgreSQL for structured data storage.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: SCTLS ensures automated notifications via email/SMS for complaint tracking, lab availability, and maintenance alerts.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: SCTLS optimizes report generation and real-time scheduling with minimal resource consumption.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: SCTLS enables structured complaint logging, efficient lab scheduling, and secure equipment documentation.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: SCTLS supports secure web-based access with real-time database synchronization.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: SCTLS links to authentication, reporting, and scheduling APIs.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: SCTLS facilitates complaint tracking, response monitoring, lab scheduling automation, and equipment documentation.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: Designed for students, faculty, and administrators managing complaints and lab schedules.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: SCTLS requires internet connectivity for real-time reporting and scheduling updates.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: SCTLS depends on database integrity, real-time scheduling updates, and secure authentication services.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Complaint Report: User-submitted issue logs for resolution tracking.
Lab Scheduling: System for reserving and tracking lab usage.
[SUBSEC] 1.9 Acronyms and Abbreviations: SCTLS: Structured Complaint Tracking and Lab Scheduling System

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall generate complaint reports for administrators and response reports for users.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall integrate with lab scheduling services and maintain equipment records.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to submit complaints, track resolution progress, and generate reports (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall automate lab scheduling, prevent conflicts, and maintain equipment documentation (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide a structured UI for complaint tracking and lab scheduling.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall generate reports with minimal delay and handle up to about a hundred concurrent complaint submissions.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store complaint records, response reports, lab schedules, and equipment logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall support web-based access with secure authentication.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall log complaint resolutions, lab modifications, and adhere to API security standards (OAuth 2.0).

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall maintain high availability for complaint tracking and scheduling functions.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Complaint tracking, report generation, and lab scheduling validated.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User guides, API references, and lab scheduling policies.
[SEC] 5. References: Complaint resolution protocols, lab management standards, and data integrity guidelines.
